posts.post_content:
*"Have you read the flavor text carefully? It's a grammatical train wreck..."*  
-Enchurito.  
  
It's perfectly grammatical.  
  
"Izzet-designed conductors atop Sunhome..."--this is the subject.  
  
"...charge empty sets of armor..."--this explains what the conductors do.  
  
"that give form to the fluctuating elementals."--and this explains what those charged suits of armor do.  
  
Boiling it down, it says, "Conductors charge armor." What kind of conductors? Conductors that sit atop Sunhome and were designed by the Izzet. What kind of armor? Empty sets of it. What does the armor do? Give form to the elementals.  
  
Your suggestion, however, makes no sense. "Izzet-designed conductors atop Sunhome charged empty sets of armor give form to the fluctuating elementals"? The tenses of the verbs don't match--"charged" vs. "give form". There needs to be a coordinating conjunction between the clauses "charged empty sets of armor" and "give form...". You wouldn't say "Izzet-designed machines generated electric... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Your suggestion, however, makes no sense. "Izzet-designed conductors atop Sunhome charged empty sets of armor give form to the fluctuating elementals"? The tenses of the verbs don't match--"charged" vs. "give form". There needs to be a coordinating conjunction between the clauses "charged empty sets of armor" and "give form...". Posted By: Superllama12 (1/22/2013 2:39:10 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Silverblade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Silverblade), [Ajani, Caller of the Pride](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani, Caller of the Pride), [Boros Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Charm)...  
  
Yep, lots of ways to make this a game-ender.  
  
Honestly, if you get to the fourth turn and haven't dealt the 8 damage to make this guy lethal, you're playing the deck wrong.  
  
T1: [Vexing Devil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vexing Devil) smashes them for four  
T2: [Boros Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Charm), same thing  
T3: [Silverblade Paladin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Silverblade Paladin) or [Ajani, Caller of the Pride](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani, Caller of the Pride)  
T4: Lethal Spark Trooper.
posts.html:
Silverblade, Ajani, Caller of the Pride, Boros Charm...

Yep, lots of ways to make this a game-ender.

Honestly, if you get to the fourth turn and haven't dealt the 8 damage to make this guy lethal, you're playing the deck wrong.

T1: Vexing Devil smashes them for four
T2: Boros Charm, same thing
T3: Silverblade Paladin or Ajani, Caller of the Pride
T4: Lethal Spark Trooper.

posts.post_content:
This is scary and good!  
I like it, since I can respect that it's not quite "overpowered" (it IS super powerful, it can net a difference of 12 life in a single attack for 4cmc only), but still balanced enough to not make it frustrating (yeah, first strike and a simple ping does it for this guy)  
4.5/5 for being quite balanced

posts.post_content:
I'm wondering how this combos with [Conjurer's Closet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Conjurer's Closet) considering you can choose the order of the stack.   
Use Closet to exile him at the beginning of the end step, he misses it, and comes back after to stay in for an extra turn.   
Expensive combo, but it should technically work, right?  
  
I wonder what other cards would work?

Posted By: L00fah (4/30/2013 12:07:10 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
People say this card is broken do not realize just how hard it is to actually play a spark trooper. It's not mindless and requires careful timing and consideration of board state.   
  
Do not play one of these things without a [Boros Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Charm) in hand. If you don't, this won't deliver enough damage to end the game. Not to mention, it does die to first strike! Preferably, you also want a way to give this thing flying, using thing such as [Ajani, Caller of the Pride](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani, Caller of the Pride) or [Gift of Orzhova](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gift of Orzhova). If you screw up, you essentially tapped out four mana for nothing. BUt if you time it just right, this almost guarantees you a win.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
I appreciate where steinburger is coming from;  
  
So they eat 4 from the [Vexing Devil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vexing Devil). This is the accepted response to a turn one devil unless you have some form of removal...for their one-drop. (or if they don't eat the four damage move on to turn two and give the vexing devil double strike with your boros charm)  
  
Turn two, [Boros Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Charm) in the head. With no counters that makes enough sense...but not always a common play to burn face on turn two.  
  
This is where my problem comes in...you play [Silverblade Paladin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Silverblade Paladin) and it doesn't die by your turn...fair, a 2/2 isn't that dangerous by itself.   
  
But if they let you play Spark Trooper and soulbond it to the Paladin the following turn without interacting with you...they deserved to lose. There is no way that that's a realistic expectation. Maybe in goldfish testing, you can slam out 20 damage in the first four turns, but if they don't play a blocker or removal or any sort of hind... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: StoneColdheart (3/24/2013 5:37:21 PM)
Rating:

@Steinburger
That's awfully presumptuous to assume that someone would rather be hit in the face by Vexing Devil twice, with no removal, rather than counter it. Further, turn 4 they have had no removal for this, the devil, or the paladin?

I get they all pour on the damage, but battlion relies on people not killing your stuff or having blockers do it, or having bounce.. or counterspells... and vexing devil comes with a free counterspell attached.

Posted By: blurrymadness (3/6/2013 8:05:44 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Ball lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ball lightning), what have they done to you?!  
  
There's now this, Ball Lightning and Spark Elemental. Next:  
  
Blightball 1BBG 6/1  
Haste, Trample, Infect. Sacrifice Blightball at the beginning of the end step.  
  
Seriously, this card isn't really all that useful. Why would you want to gain life in an aggro Boros deck? It's flavourful I suppose but still a bit silly. Much rather [Ball Lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ball Lightning) for aggro.  
  
@Capncrunch: It's fine for the game. Who wants lifegain in an aggro deck? It's a really silly fit. And you would never use this card outside aggro so it's just a waste. If you want too powerful, try [Ball Lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ball Lightning) or [Goblin Guide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Guide) which both make ten times as much sense for an aggro deck.
posts.html:
Ball lightning, what have they done to you?!

There's now this, Ball Lightning and Spark Elemental. Next:

Blightball 1BBG 6/1
Haste, Trample, Infect. Sacrifice Blightball at the beginning of the end step.

Seriously, this card isn't really all that useful. Why would you want to gain life in an aggro Boros deck? It's flavourful I suppose but still a bit silly. Much rather Ball Lightning for aggro.

@Capncrunch: It's fine for the game. Who wants lifegain in an aggro deck? It's a really silly fit. And you would never use this card outside aggro so it's just a waste. If you want too powerful, try Ball Lightning or Goblin Guide which both make ten times as much sense for an aggro deck.
